issue.title: Repeated SingleStat panel with variable All option doesn't handle missing values when prefix is filled
issue.body:
Resembles #6595 a bit
Please include this information:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.4
### What datasource are you using?
grafana-zabbix 3.9.0 (Zabbix 2.4.6)
### What OS are you running grafana on?
Centos 7
### What did you do?
- Setup SingleStat panel with repeat on variable $ssk_id. 
- Entered variable $ssk_id as value prefix:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14870891/38132668-a8b5e250-3414-11e8-8d33-b8d9f109bc12.png)
- Applied value map value to text: null -> Н/Д
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14870891/38132729-fec60f76-3414-11e8-8c38-08ed5d126cdd.png)
- Then choose variable option **All** on the dashboard


### What was the expected result?
when value of single stat missing(null) then show repeated single stat panel with:
$ssk_id: Н/Д

### What happened instead?
- variable $ssk_id expanded to a list of all possible values in braces when value is missing(null)
- But, it's all fine when the value is present:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14870891/38132787-42495f1e-3415-11e8-843a-8db0eba5f425.png)
- If you remove variable from prefix: it works fine - null is changed to Н/Д
- If you choose variable $ssk_id other than 'All' then it works fine.

issue.title: Strange artefact with "Min/MaxMean Graph" and "For each value of" option
issue.body:
Hello,

i create a MMM Graph using the following configuration:

### What datasource are you using? ==> InfluxDb

### What OS are you running grafana on? ==> CentOS

issue.title: Unable to add graphite functions in the latest build
issue.body:
Hi there. I faced quite weird issue while was trying to upgrade grafana. It's not possible to add functions to the query (there is no button for it). Chrome console contains the following error message:
```
Error: [$injector:unpr] Unknown provider: tProvider <- t <- graphiteAddFuncDirective
```
It's still possible to add function manually in edit mode so the issue is not very critical for me. The strangest thing in this situation is that I can't reproduce the issue in development mode. I can reproduce it only with grafana-server launched.
My current branch is at b41370ca498816f444363ed7511dced638dc54f6

comment.body: We missed adding an `/** @ngInject */` when converting this file from JavaScript to TypeScript. Angular injection works fine without it in development but not in the production build.

issue.title: Improve file structure in the grafana repo
issue.body:
* create new folder named `devenv`
* move `docker` to `devenv/ds-docker`
* create folder for provisioned dev datasources `devenv/ds-config`
* create folder for provisioned dev dashboards `devenv/dashboards`
* create bashscript for coping(windows)/symlining(nix) `dashboards.yaml` & `datasources.yaml` into `conf/provisioning`
* move `tests` into `devenv/tests`. (test config files can be moved to `/pkg/settings/test-data`
* move `scripts/benchmark` to `devenv/benchmark`
* move `examples` to `devenv/examples` (or just nuke it)

I would like to rename `scripts` to `build` but I'm not sure its worth it considering all how many paths we would have to update.

issue.title: docker: add users and groups to ldap block
issue.body:
Prepopulates the openldap db in the openldap docker block with some users and groups.

Adds three users, `ldapviewer`, `ldapeditor` and `ldapadmin`.  Two groups `admins` and `users` are added that correspond with the group mappings in the default conf/ldap.toml. `ldapadmin` is a member of `admins` and  `ldapeditor` is a member of users.

issue.title: Linking to a panel inside a collapsed row does not work
issue.body:
### Version
v5.0.1-pre1 (commit: b1494637d)

### Steps
1. Create a dashboard with a default-collapsed row
1. Expand the row, but do not save the dashboard
1. View a panel inside that row in fullscreen
1. Copy the URL into a new browser tab or window

### Expected
Panel is shown fullscreen

### Actual
Dashboard renders as if visiting normally, but loads no data and simply shows blank panels (if there are any outside of the collapsed row). No error is presented.

Once you expand the collapsed panel, you are immediately shown the originally linked panel in fullscreen, with data seemingly already loaded and rendered.

issue.title: Alerts - "Plain Text" (i.e., non-html) Email Option?
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
Grafana v5.0.4 (commit: 7dc36ae)
### What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker CE (18.02.0-ce, build fc4de44) on Debian Linux (Stretch/9)
 
### Feature Request
Alerts within Grafana work great, and I have no problem with email alerts.

However, when use email alerts to send via my cell provider's email to MMS gateway (which works REALLY well), Grafana still tries to send an HTML email (understandable).

Can we get an option for alerts that is (for example) "Plain Text Email" (as opposed to the existing "Email" option, which is really "Rich Email")?  This would allow much better quality alerts to go through, and would avoid me receiving a message that includes a dump of raw html (which is what the gateway does to the Grafana HTML message).

Thanks!

issue.title: Interval parsing error for intervals values expressed in days
issue.body:
Grafana: 5.0.3
Grafana host: Windows 7 Pro, 64 bit
MySQL server: Maria DB 10.2, Debian Jessie 64 bit

**Background**
My data source is a MySQL table of network ping tests, collected hourly, covering several years worth of data. 

Table Spec:
```
+-------------+-------------------------------
| Field       | Type
+-------------+-------------------------------
| id          | int(10) unsigned
| source      | enum(<list of source hostnames>)
| target      | enum(<list of ping targets>)
| packet_size | smallint(4)
| start       | datetime
| min         | decimal(5,1)        
| mean        | decimal(5,1)
| max         | decimal(5,1)
| %_lost      | decimal(5,1)
+-------------+--------------------------------
```
Grafana Query Spec:
```
SELECT
  MAX(UNIX_TIMESTAMP(`start`)) as time_sec,
  AVG(`%_lost`) as value,
  '%_lost' as metric
FROM `ping`
WHERE $__timeFilter(`start`)
GROUP BY $__timeGroup(start, $interval)
ORDER BY $__timeGroup(start, $interval) ASC
```

**Issue**
The the default set of values for a variable of type **_interval_** is: 1m,10m,30m,1h,6h,12h,1d,7d,14d,30d

However if I select any of the intervals expressed in days, the Grafana query fails and the display chart is blank.

Looking at the chart specification you can see that Grafana's generation of the SQL query fails for an interval expressed in days such as "7d".

It looks as if the `$__timeGroup()` function can't handle intervals in days. As the default intervals include values in days I interpret this as a bug, but if this is consdered to be `$__timeGroup()` working as designed, then please mark this as an enhancement request.

comment.body:
grafana uses ParseDuration from the go time standard library which only supports up to hour. This is intentional from their side since a day isnt as clearly defined and could be between 23 und 25 hours. 
Since grafana does the timeGroup calculations on unix timestamps we wouldnt have to worry about daylight saving time and could set 1d to 24 hours but would have to implement our own interval parsing.
